content: You can set a default account by - highlighting account in left pane - rightclick and select settings - scroll down to 'account actions' and select 'default account'
creator: davidsk

Please enter a different account name." I have another address - "mazawatea@ntlworld.com" with two entries on Thunderbird! This all occured as I installed a new computer!
creator: johnmarris

content: If your concern is to keep the accounts, but not on Thunderbird, just highlight the accounts, rightclick and select 'settings', then scroll down to 'account actions' and click delete.

content:
SSL and TLS both refer to secure connection protocols. TLS has superseded SSL as a technical matter, but SSL is still used colloquially.

The preference values correspond to:

  • 1 => TLS 1.0
  • 2 => TLS 1.1
  • 3 => TLS 1.2 [default "min" because older versions are deemed insecure]
  • 4 => TLS 1.3 [default "max"]

A few years ago, 0 indicated SSL 3.0, but Thunderbird no longer supports SSL 3.0.
creator: jscher2000
